data.title: Improved RA mod AI (yaml tweaks)
data.body:
- Removed kennels from AI.
- Tweaked Turtle AI to build more defenses and less excess adv. power plants, works better in conjunction with #8759.
- Fixed soviet paratroops target evaluation so it doesn't always fail.
- Removed obsolete sniper entry.

Fixes #8564.

data.title: Removes unnecessary code from IngameChatLogic.cs.
data.body: Cleanup after #8105. Reverts part of #6473.

data.title: MenuPaletteEffect->Effect: Desaturated is bugged
data.body:
Having that set on the `^BaseWorld` will start a normal game in desaturated mode but one gets colors after opening and closing the menu.

If you choose to make a map it adds 16 to the height bounds, so 128x128 will create a 128x144 sized map

data.title: Fix not being able to select enemy units
data.body:
Closes #8802.

I liked it, though :/

data.title: Health bars disappear over enemy units after selecting them when "Always show status bars" is enabled
data.body: Introduced in a3bd007ac708019ff4d6ffa7d4aee7c377b57d97 (part of #8388), according to git bisect.

data.title: Remap TS refinery/silo icon color to player color
data.body:
Tiberian Sun uses the same production icon with different "player" color (Yellow for GDI, Red for Nod) for several structures ([source](http://xhp.xwis.net/ts_icons/)):
- Refinery
- Silo
- EMP Cannon

Since that is a bit restrictive, and we have the technology, I propose we remap those to the actual color the player is.
Those aren't building decoration colors. Those parts of the buildings are remapped to the player color. So why not remap them on the icons as well?

data.title: Selection-Box doesnt work on enemy units
data.body:
selection box doesnt show up anymore when doing a left-click/rubberband-selection on enemy units 
something is broken here ... (reproducible only with fog/shroud "ON") 

http://logs.openra.net/?year=2015&month=06&day=29#16:13:38

data.title: Removes attack cursor on disguised spies.
data.body: The attack cursor will not be shown on enemy spies disguised as own unit. Force firing is required to attack them. I also want to make them selectable like player's own units but couldn't find the code where it's determined.

data.title: Fixed deployed vehicles being treated as buildings
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8521.

data.title: Added support to specify the package/folder in the virtual file system for Tiberian Sun Cabal/EVA voices and Nod/GDI icons
data.body:
Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6353. 
Closes #8803. See http://xhp.xwis.net/ts_icons/ for reference.

data.title: Prevent running an upgrade rule on already-upgraded rules.
data.body:
I've planned this for quite a few months but finally decided to make an issue instead of doing it myself when I have free time (which is almost never).

My idea is a comment at the top of the file that indicates the last version that the rules were updated to.
Then the upgrader reads this line and won't run any rules that would have already been ran.
This should of course be overrideable (either via flag or just removing the line).

``` yaml
#20150614

engineer:
        Inherits: ^Infantry
        Buildable:
                Queue: Infantry
                BuildPaletteOrder: 60
        Valued:
                Cost: 500
        Tooltip:
                Name: Engineer
                Description: Captures enemy structures.\n  Unarmed
        Selectable:
                Bounds: 20, 30, 0, -11
        Health:
                HP: 75
        Mobile:
                Speed: 56
        Passenger:
                PipType: Blue
        EngineerRepair:
        RepairsBridges:
        Captures:
                CaptureTypes: building, husk
        -AutoTarget:
        WithInfantryBody:
        RevealsShroud:
                Range: 4c0
        Voiced:
                VoiceSet: AlliedEngineerVoice
```

Or maybe start the line with `#%` or similar to indicate the line is special, or have metainfo such as:
`# last-rule: 20150614`
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/24976864-prevent-running-an-upgrade-rule-on-already-upgraded-rules?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Add a GpsRemoveFrozenActor trait
data.body:
Fixes #8096.

If you have an active GpsPower, frozen actors are removed when the "real" actor is dead or sold.

I had to revert https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7510 because that is not available nor install-able in the new @Travis-CI environment. http://docs.travis-ci.com/user/migrating-from-legacy

data.title: Live tiles (Windows 10) and Notifications (OSX)
data.body:
With the upcoming Windows 10's Start menu and its "live tiles": http://frawin.com/files/2015/04/Windows-8-livetile.gif ... it's possible to display informations from different kind of media : RSS feeds, databases, websites... (?).

Could it be possible to display, in one of these tiles: 
- number of open games
- number of awaiting players 
- Battlefield messages (tournaments, new releases announcements)? 

More info on how to create live tiles: 
https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/hh761464.aspx
https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/hh465403.aspx

@pchote said that it could be possible to do something similar for OSX too in the notification center.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/24972460-live-tiles-windows-10-and-notifications-osx?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Remove unnecessary Lazy<>s from Sandworm.cs
data.body: Without looking at the commit history, I don't know why they're there. They were probably added before `Requires<MobileInfo>, Requires<WithSpriteBodyInfo>, Requires<AttackBaseInfo>` was.

data.title: Changes shroud lobby setting from disabling shroud to revealing it.
data.body:
Disabling shroud in lobby will reveal shroud at game start. It does the same thing as clear shroud debug option. But shroud as a gameplay element will still be available. This means that gap generators will work.

Fixes #6123.

data.title: Fix an NRE when cancelling repair orders on units at the wrong time
data.body:
Fixes #8789.

Not too easy to reproduce (although I managed once). I suggest using the replay from #8781.

data.title: Revert "Lower aircraft altitude"
data.body:
This reverts prs #7842, #7866.

Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8018.

data.body:
```
Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Activities.WaitForTransport.Cancel (OpenRA.Actor self) [0x0001f] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Mods.Common//Activities/WaitForTransport.cs:48 
  at OpenRA.Actor.CancelActivity () [0x00013] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Actor.cs:178 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Repairable.ResolveOrder (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Order order) [0x000b4] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Mods.Common//Traits/Repairable.cs:96 
  at OpenRA.Network.UnitOrders.ProcessOrder (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager, OpenRA.World world, Int32 clientId, OpenRA.Order order) [0x00c87] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Network/UnitOrders.cs:305 
  at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.Tick () [0x000b9] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Network/OrderManager.cs:212 
  at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x0019d] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Game.cs:475 
  at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick () [0x0004e] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Game.cs:507 
  at OpenRA.Game.Loop () [0x000d4] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Game.cs:631 
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00042] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Game.cs:671 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00011] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Support/Program.cs:111 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00050] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Support/Program.cs:39 
```

Regression introduced by the d2k carryall / repair integration.  Crash was in TS, but this may also be an issue in RA and TD.  I can't repro this with a simple skirmish, so there's probably a timing or unit-interaction aspect to it.

data.title: Inter-Trait Handling
data.body:
An attempt to make inter-trait handling more robust and add information to trait docs.

Inter-Trait Handling Part 1: #8785.

Inter-Trait Handling Parts 2 & 3:
- `InitializeAfter<Trait>`, `RequiresSingleton<Trait>`, `Uses<Trait>`, and `Requires<Trait>` Split (In progress)
  - `InitializeAfter<Trait>` if `.Trait[OrDefault]<T>` or the like is called in trait constructor.
  - `Uses<Trait>` if trait uses other but does not cache it. (for trait docs)
  - `Requires<Trait>` if trait requires other but does not cache it.
  - `RequiresSingleton<SingletonTrait>` if SingletonTrait is required.
- `IMultipleTraitInfo` or `IManyTraitInfo`
  - Allow multiple instances of trait only if it implements `IMultipleTraitInfo`
  - Add multiplicity information to trait docs including singleton trait interfaces dropping the `I` in front and `TraitInfo` at the end.

Inter-Trait Handling Parts 4+:
- Change `INotifyCreated.Create(Actor self)` to `INotifyCreated<T>.Create(T obj)`
  - This will allow more complex interaction with `UpgradeManager` such as changing upgrades and responding to upgrade changes.
    - This would allow for more complex condition/upgrade expressions.
  - This will allow more complex interactions than simple caching.
- Add `CachedTrait<Trait>` to provide better handing and error messages than using `Lazy<Trait>`.
- ~~Support inter-trait caching similar to the way `FieldLoader` works.~~
  - ~~`[ActorInitializor.Ignore]`, `[ActorInitializor.Single[OrDefault]]`, `[ActorInitializor.First[OrDefault]]`, and `[ActorInitializor.Many/Multiple]`.~~
- Remove `Lazy<Trait>` and other tricks that may cause problems based on trait construction order using the above.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/24947974-inter-trait-handling?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Singleton Traits - Implicit & Interface
data.body:
Requires #8848.
This is how I discovered the issue addressed by #8774.

Allows for singleton traits, that coordinate or otherwise manage other traits, such as `UpgradeManager` to be included automatically and allows checking for inclusion of multiple traits implementing the same singleton interface (usually accessed by `.Trait[OrDefault]` or `.Traits.Get[OrDefault]`).
Is part of my effort to improve inter-trait handling (#8786).

data.title: Added helicopter takeoff and landing sound
data.body: Used for Tiberian Sun dropships.

data.title: Re-enable mission replays
data.body:
Replays for missions have been disabled in #6442 due to the issues mentioned there.

The first of these has been fixed a while ago when FMV playback was moved into the UI.

The second is fixed by the first commit in this PR.

data.title: Added the Tiberian Sun Temple of Nod
data.body: Completing the tech tree.

data.title: Add plumbing for heighmap-aware shroud and map bounds checks.
data.body:
This introduces a new coordinate system ("projected map cells", or `PPos`) for code that deals with the map border and shroud.  For mods that don't use terrain height `PPos` maps identically to `MPos`.

From the first commit message:

```
PPos is best thought of as a cell grid applied in
screen space.  Multiple cells with different
terrain heights may be projected to the same PPos,
or to multiple PPos if they do not align with the
screen grid (i.e. odd-height or sloped).

PPos coordinates are used primarily for map edge
checks and shroud / visibility queries.
```

For the sake of keeping the PR as reviewable as possible I have limited this to what we need for the shroud.  Future PRs will deal with the map-edge coordinate helpers which are fiddly and harder to review.

Expected behaviour with this PR applied is for there to be no visible changes in TD/RA/D2K, and for the TS shroud rendering to behave logically.  Edge of map behaviour in TS should be no worse than in current bleed.

data.title: Crates are not collectable in TS
data.body: Introduced by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8339/files#diff-8e8bb64e0c97a0eb2f07e03046a5628fR67.  This needs to do a proper ground check.
